content.description: Really a great route.  Give it a try!  The route starts to the left of Romb-a-saurus.  Start on the same boulder as Romb-a-saurus but left side instead of right side.  Step across the small gap onto the triangular shaped part of the shelf.  The first hold is a sharp right facing flake.  Move to the left along the shelf and once you are under two edges, start heading up.  Move up and towards the arete.  Once obtaining the arete with your left hand, move up and to the right using sharp holds on the arete.  Eventually you will gain the obvious jug at the top and top-out.
content.protection: Anchors set on other side of the boulder similar to The Romb and Romb-a-saurus.  You can set its own anchors or use a directional from the anchors set for the other two routes.  Put TR anchors just to the left of the finishing jug.
content.location: To the left of Romb-a-saurus and Rombatron.  Southeast corner/side of the Romb.  The Romb is located downhill and East of Ding Dongs and Taco Sauce and uphill and East of The Dairy Farm boulders.

content.description: Starts on the ground and you pull over the lip and into up the left leaning crack and ascend to top. Easy to spot the large bulge near the top.  Can set TR by building anchor on the other side of the boulder or it can be bouldered.
content.protection: TR with creative anchor system or Crash pad with very alert spotter
content.location: Located on the East side of the Romb.  The Romb is the large boulder downhill and Southeast of Ding Dongs and Taco Sauce and up hill and Northeast of the Dairy Farm boulders.

content.description: To the left of Rombatron.  Step off of the boulder and onto the wall and move upward on crystals. Not climbed very often.  Sustained and sharp.  Crux might be getting onto the wall, starting the route and moving up towards the first second set of hand holds.
content.protection: TR or bouldering pad. Definitely a high ball bouldering problem.  Be careful.  Not climbed frequently.  Holds might break (a big foothold broke on me.)
content.location: On the East side of the Romb boulder to the left of Rombatron.  Starts by stepping off the right side of the boulder and onto the wall.

content.description: Start on a broken jug/crimp rail above a small, flat rock that is shaped like the state of Idaho. Move up on more crimps.
content.location: On the northern side of the huge boulder that is east (downhill) from the Rhombatron boulder. Directly right of a rotten ramp boulder problem (Blind Man's Bluff).

content.description: Group of boulders with several fun problems in close proximity to the popular Dairy Farm boulders.
